Comment: Agreed, it is crazy risky  There's a pretty convincing book called Bitten that makes the case that Lyme disease was also an accidental lab leak.  It sounds crazy, but the evidence is convincing.  Here's the tldr:  In the '70s, we had a bioweapons lab on Plum Island that was conducting gain of research experiments. There are C.I.A. documents that confirm at this lab we were infecting ticks with air-bourne diseases to be used as a bioweapon against adversaries.  At this time, the closest major population to this lab was East Lyme Connecticut, which is where there was the first major breakout of Lyme disease - hence the reason why it is called Lyme Disease. William Burgdorfer was the main scientist at Plum Island who was conducting this research, and before his death he alluded to Lyme Disease being a lab leak.  I'm not saying it was deliberate, nor do I think Lyme Disease would make for an effective bioweapon, but all of those coincidences are really suspicious and we can't rule out an accidental lab leak
